title: Sweat to Start Free Election-Season Tour Across Midwest
description: Lynn Nottages Pulitzer Prize-winning play Sweat will soon arrive in communities much like the one it depicts. The play, which explores the anxieties of the working class in Middle America, will embark on a free monthlong run through 18 cities this fall as part of the Public Theaters Mobile Unit initiative.

title: The Old Beer Hall in the Bronx
description: Q. I remember an abandoned multi-story wood building at Boston Post Road (U.S. Rte. 1) and Dyre Avenue in the Bronx. I was told that it was a beer garden. Whats the story here?

title: Russia, Pope Francis, Apple: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Judge Dismisses Two Lawsuits Against Fox News Over Retracted Seth Rich Story
description: A federal judge in Manhattan dismissed a lawsuit Thursday that was brought against Fox News by the parents of Seth Rich, the young Democratic aide whose unsolved murder was turned into fodder for a lingering right-wing conspiracy theory.

title: Michael Sheehan, Prescient Counterterrorism Expert, Dies at 63
description: WASHINGTON  Michael A. Sheehan, a former top counterterrorism official for the State Department, the Pentagon and New York City, who sounded an early, and unheeded, warning about Osama bin Laden and the dangers of Al Qaeda before 9/11, died on Monday in Bethesda, Md. He was 63.

title: Leslie Moonves Speaks on CBS Earnings Call but Not About Harassment Allegations
description: For Leslie Moonves, the chief executive of the CBS Corporation, it was back to business as usual.

title: Trump and Italys Conte: Brothers in Nativism
description: President Trump likes to claim that his meetings with foreign leaders are one huge victory after another in promoting his worldview. The reality is usually far different, but measured by this yardstick, his meeting with Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte of Italy was a smashing success. Standing alongside the president in the White House East Room, Mr. Conte sang praises to Mr. Trump for positions and stances which are expressed with clarity, and offered to be his privileged interlocutor in Europe.

title: The Myth That a Cleaner Car Is Less Safe Than a Dirty One
description: To justify rolling back auto gas mileage and emissions rules, the Trump administration has fabricated a false conflict between safety and improved fuel economy. The administration is wrong. Americans must have both, and can.

title: Stop Calling Trump a Populist
description: Message to those in the news media who keep calling Donald Trump a populist: I do not think that word means what you think it means.

title: Amazon Removes Products Featuring Nazi Symbols
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Amazon said this week that it would not let third-party retailers sell products that feature Nazi and white nationalist symbolism on its platform, amid pressure from nonprofit groups and lawmakers.

title: Top City Health Official, Who Faced Down Ebola and Zika, Will Resign
description: The New York City health commissioner, Mary T. Bassett, who coordinated the citys response to a series of health crises involving Ebola, Legionnaires disease and the looming threat of the Zika virus, is leaving her job to take a top post at Harvard University, the city announced on Thursday.

title: Young Rudy Giuliani Defends Himself
description: 1951. Seven-year-old Rudy Giuliani is caught by his mother with his hand in the cookie jar and crumbs around his mouth.

title: Betty Miles, Whose Childrens Books Tackled Sexism, Dies at 90
description: Betty Miles, a writer whose books for children and young adults addressed real-life issues like sexism, racism and censorship after she had thrown off the conventions of the 1950s to become a feminist, died on July 19 at her home in Shelburne, Vt. She was 90.

title: The Latest Ebola Outbreak Is Centered in a War Zone
description: A cluster of Ebola cases in the Democratic Republic of Congo  just one week after it declared an end to an outbreak on the other side of the country  is especially worrying because the new infections are in a war zone.

title: CNNs Jim Acosta Challenges Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Then Makes a Quick Exit
description: Jim Acosta, the square-jawed CNN correspondent, has stood out among the White House press corps for his impassioned on-air monologues about the importance of the First Amendment.

title: Trump Administration Moves Ahead With Tariffs on Canadian Newsprint
description: WASHINGTON  The Commerce Department said on Thursday that it would proceed with tariffs on Canadian newsprint, a blow to an already-struggling American newspaper industry.

title: Apples $1 Trillion Milestone Reflects Rise of Powerful Megacompanies
description: U.S. Steel. General Motors. AT&T. Exxon Mobil.

title: In Retrial of Norman Seabrook, All Eyes on an Imperfect Witness
description: For the second time in less than a year, Norman Seabrook, the former longtime president of New York Citys correction officers union, went on trial on federal corruption charges.

title: Ian Poulter Leads Bridgestone Invitational. Lets Talk About Tiger Woods.
description: AKRON, Ohio  The Sky Sports reporter Nick Dougherty was about to address Kyle Stanley, who had carded a seven-under 63 for the early first-round lead Thursday at the Bridgestone Invitational. But then Doughertys attention drifted from Stanley to the television monitor in his peripheral vision, which showed Tiger Woods out on the Firestone Country Club course.

title: Quotation of the Day: Beijing Buddhist Leader Accused of Harassment
description: There is a limit on how far and how high up public discussions can go before it gets on the leaderships nerves.

title: No Credit, No Problem for Todd Howe, Who Is Freed on Bail
description: The story of Todd R. Howe, the disgraced government witness who helped federal prosecutors investigate major New York State corruption cases, always seems to come down to credit cards and second chances  both of which seem to pose problems for Mr. Howe.

title: Urban Meyer and the New Era of College Football: Winning Isnt Everything
description: Until this week, Ohio States Urban Meyer was among the most valuable coaches in college football.

title: How the U.S. Is Fighting Russian Election Interference
description: WASHINGTON  Senior Trump administration officials warned on Thursday that Russia is trying to interfere in Novembers midterm elections and the 2020 presidential election and vowed to combat Moscows aggression.

title: Tennessee Republicans Select Newcomer, Spurning Trump Loyalist in Governors Race
description: Tennessee Republicans chose Bill Lee, a wealthy businessman who has never served in elected office, as their nominee for governor on Thursday, spurning a conservative candidate who eagerly sought  but only glancingly received  the support of President Trumps White House.

title: Prosecutors Document Paul Manaforts Reversal of Fortune After 2014
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.  A day after describing in detail how millions of dollars in payments from Ukrainian oligarchs enabled Paul Manafort to live in luxury through 2014, federal prosecutors outlined on Thursday how his financial fortunes reversed so sharply in subsequent years that he made his Manhattan condominium available on Airbnb.

title: Yankees and Red Sox Face Off, Eager to Deploy New Weapons
description: BOSTON  Alex Cora keeps track of the standings, always aware of just how close the Yankees are to his Red Sox. But Cora, the rookie Boston manager, knows that the landscape really only crystallizes in September, when teams at last get a clear sense of themselves.

title: Corrections: August 3, 2018
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Review: Mike Birbiglia Has a New One. Its Funny Until It Isnt.
description: The comedian and storyteller Mike Birbiglia didnt want to become a father. He had his reasons. Heres the fifth one: He has a job. A baby, he says, would spit up all over that. Kids hold us back.

title: Colorado Man Who Killed Naked Intruder Is Fatally Shot by the Police
description: A 73-year-old Aurora, Colo., man who fatally shot a naked intruder who broke into his home, only to be killed by one of the police officers who responded, may not have heard orders to put down his gun because of a hearing impairment, the police said Thursday.

title: With Ones Glass Raised
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE   This one made me smile, for two reasons: First, because the entries were entertaining, and second, because its an impressive fill for someone who was so young when he made it.

title: Review: In Christopher Robin, the Hundred Acre Wood Grows Up
description: Christopher Robin answers a question that has weighed on the minds of all children and former children who bear some affection for Winnie the Pooh, Piglet and the rest of the Hundred Acre Wood. Namely, what if Christopher Robin grew up to become a giant stick in the mud?

title: Top New Hampshire Democrat Arrested on Domestic Violence Charges
description: A leading Democratic legislator in New Hampshire was arrested on Thursday on charges of domestic violence and assault.

title: Myanmar Official Line: Rohingya Are Returning. But Cracks in That Story Abound.
description: MAUNGDAW, Myanmar  We waded through floodwaters, past soldiers hefting rifles, and climbed into a prefabricated hut.

title: Red Sox Pummel Yankees, Leaving No Mistake Unpunished
description: BOSTON  It is hard to pinpoint exactly where the Yankees lost it all against Boston on Thursday night  getting off the team bus, perhaps  but, sifting through the offensive avalanche led by Steve Pearces three home runs, the fourth inning would be a good place to start.

title: U.S. Is Expanding Power to Block Chinese Firms. HNA Was Already No Match.
description: WASHINGTON  Just over a year ago, two senior executives from the giant Chinese conglomerate HNA landed a meeting with Steven Mnuchin, the United States Treasury secretary, at his office. The executives, Adam Tan and Guang Yang, snapped a photo with Mr. Mnuchin, holding a model plane of the HNA-owned carrier, Hainan Airlines.

title: Trumps Inaccurate Claims About Highways, Immigration and Beyonc From a Pennsylvania Rally
description: President Trump, at a campaign rally on Thursday night in Wilkes-Barre, Pa.

title: Trump Bashes Fake News: They Can Make Anything Bad
description: WILKES-BARRE, Pa.  President Trump devoted the majority of his time at a rowdy rally here on Thursday targeting the news media, deriding the reporters present as fake, fake disgusting news.

title: How I Lost the Fianc but Won the Honeymoon
description: My email junk folder is like a glimpse into a fantastical world where Ray-Bans are free and Michael Kors is always having a sale. Typically I dont open any before clicking delete all, but that day one caught my eye: Congratulations Nell Stevens! You have won a luxury honeymoon to India!

title: Red Soxs Steve Pearce Proves He Fits With a Timely Outburst
description: BOSTON  The phrasing is all so clinical, precise verbiage that all means the same thing: A ballplayer on the move. Steve Pearce experienced all of these designations in 2012 alone: released, signed as a free agent, purchased, selected off waivers. He bounced from the Minnesota Twins to the Yankees to the Baltimore Orioles to the Houston Astros, then back to the Yankees and the Orioles again. His Yankees career lasted just 12 games, and he hit .160.

title: Pope Francis, Trade War, Apple: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Friday: Quantico and Lollapalooza
description: Quantico shows its series finale. And Post Malone and Tyler, the Creator perform live from Lollapalooza.

title: Australias Big Banks Have Stranglehold on Consumers, Government Says
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Australias four biggest banks have used their dominant position to exploit customers, deliver inferior products, charge exorbitant fees and block competition, according to a new government report calling for more competition and integrity in the industry.

title: A Familys 400-Year-Old Musical Secret Still Rings True
description: The surest route to a drummers heart? Cymbals.

title: Trevor Noah Shows How Apple Got Its Valuation to $1 Trillion
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If youre interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.

title: News Quiz: Test Your Knowledge of the Weeks Headlines
description: Did you stay up to date this week?

title: For Many N.J. Transit Commuters, Last Years Summer of Hell Is Now
description: New Jerseys new governor, Philip D. Murphy, a Democrat, has promised the states commuters that train service would improve after years of decline. What he did not warn them was that it would get so much worse before it got better.

title: Murder, Politics and Architecture: The Making of Madison Square Park
description: From 19th-Century circuses and swanky hotels to an art and foodie destination today, this 6.2-acre green space continues to represent a city that is constantly reinventing itself.

title: My Father Staged His Suicide to Look Like a Murder
description: I chose to sit in the overflow seating at my fathers funeral. Through a fuzzy speaker I listened as his new family eulogized a person who woke up every day with a smile on his face. His stepson wept as he declared that he considered my father, Alan Abrahamson, his real father.

title: This Months Quiz: How Smart a Traveler Are You?
description: Here are a few questions, taken from recent articles in our Travel Tips collection, to test your travel savvy.

title: Rumpelstiltskin Redux
description: SPINNING SILVER By Naomi Novik 466 pp. Del Rey. $28.

title: Workers Hardest Hit by Recession Are Joining in Recovery
description: The least educated American workers, who took the hardest hit in the Great Recession, were also among the slowest to harvest the gains of the recovery. Now they are a striking symbol of a strong economy.

title: Classical Myths Filtered Through a Modern Prism
description: METAMORPHICA By Zachary Mason 282 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $26.

title: How Alex Branson, Entrepreneur, Spends Her Sundays
description: Alex Branson decided to get serious about her idea for an inclusive music program for babies and toddlers while under someone elses parachute at someone elses music class, when she was working as a caregiver in London. Six years later, her company, Lavender Blues, is offering classes throughout six Brooklyn neighborhoods. A nanny for more than 14 years with a background in early childhood education, Ms. Branson, 38, prides herself on having cultivated a community of families (and bunnies, as she refers to the children). She lives with her wife, Toni, 36, the creator of Style Is Freedom, a genderless streetwear brand, and their cat, Betty, in Flatbush, Brooklyn.

title: For Marilyn Stasio, Any Place Can Be the Scene of the Crime
description: Who does what? Readers usually wonder about the mechanics of smoothly successful collaborations like that of Jonathan Kellerman and his son, Jesse. There are no psychologically wounded children in A MEASURE OF DARKNESS (Ballantine, $28.99), which would tip us to the hand of Kellerman pre. But a loving exchange between a college student and his grandmother (a homemade coconut cake as a reward for a quick visit) suggests a more youthful sensibility. As for the keen sense of drama, it must be a genetic trait.

title: Beowulf Gets a 21st-Century Update
description: THE MERE WIFEBy Maria Dahvana Headley308 pp. MCD/Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $27.

title: Democrats See an Opening in Kansas if Trump Ally Wins Primary
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  The evolution of the Kansas Republican Party mirrors that of the national party, a rightward shift from the moderation of Dwight D. Eisenhower to the mainstream conservatism of Bob Dole to the small-government absolutism of former Gov. Sam Brownback and Wichita-based Koch Industries.

title: Zephyr Teachout Is Running for Attorney General. But Her Real Target Is Trump.
description: Because of the internet, governments, corporations and citizens of other countries can now meaningfully participate in United States elections, began the article in The Berkeley Journal of International Law. They can, in short, influence who wins and who loses. Depending on your intuitions, this might seem like a very good thing, or the beginning of the end of democratic self-governance.

title: When a House Is So Much More
description: Buying a home is the biggest financial transaction most people will undertake in their lives. It can also be one of the most emotional.

title: The Woman Who Created a Monster
description: IN SEARCH OF MARY SHELLEY By Fiona Sampson 304 pp. Pegasus Books. $28.95.

title: A Cheapskates Guide to Dublin, Rich in History and Beer
description: My instructor, a woman named ine, urged me on: Do it for your country! A group of us that had booked a traditional Irish games experience through Experience Gaelic Games (35 euros, about $42) stood out on a green field one hot afternoon in northern Dublin. ine, having taught us the ways of hurling, a lacrosse-like game possibly as old as Ireland itself, was now instructing us in the ways of Gaelic football, which is played with a soccer ball-like orb. My immediate task: to juggle the ball off my foot while running toward a pair of goal posts, and then punt it through the uprights. My country, I thought, is about to be mighty disappointed.

title: A Radar Blip, a Flash of Light: How U.F.O.s Exploded Into Public View
description: In the early morning of July 20, 1952, Capt. S.C. Casey Pierman was ready for takeoff at Washington National Airport, when a bright light skimmed the horizon and disappeared. He did not think much of it until he was airborne, bound for Detroit, and an air traffic controller told him two or three unidentified flying objects were spotted on radar traveling at high speed.

title: The Book Everyone in the Netherlands Is Talking About Is Finally Coming to the U.S.
description: AMSTERDAM  Astrid Holleeder is a household name here in the Netherlands. If youve never heard of her, thats about to change.

title: See the Scars That Oil Exploration Cut Across Alaskas Wilderness
description: Matt Nolan, who runs a mapping business in Alaska using aerial photography, was flying a small plane to the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in the northeastern part of the state last month when he noticed a pattern on the tundra.

title: Diana Taurasi and Brittney Griner Are the W.N.B.A.s Iconic Duo. Dont Wait.
description: For Diana Taurasi, the success she and Brittney Griner have found in the 2018 W.N.B.A season has done nothing less than change her perspective on the arc of her remarkable career.

title: The Podcast Bros Want to Optimize Your Life
description: Do you want to optimize your life? Start your morning with a kale-garlic-ginger smoothie, or better yet, meditate and fast until noon. Next, hit the gym for your mixed martial arts workout and take a cold shower to activate your immune system. Then plan this summers vision quest: Maybe youll head to the jungles of Peru, where a shaman will brew you some mescaline-laced psychedelic tea  dont worry; the intense nausea means youre grasping new dimensions of reality.

title: Popes Death Penalty Stance Wont Stop Execution, Nebraskas Catholic Governor Says
description: LINCOLN, Neb.  When Nebraska lawmakers defied Gov. Pete Ricketts in 2015 by repealing the death penalty over his strong objections, the governor wouldnt let the matter go. Mr. Ricketts, a Republican who is Roman Catholic, tapped his family fortune to help bankroll a referendum to reinstate capital punishment, a measure the states Catholic leadership vehemently opposed.

title: What Causes Morning Sickness?
description: Q. Why dont we know more about what causes morning sickness? With millions of data points annually, it seems like there should be good data!

title: Weekly Health Quiz: Alan Alda, Fat Pets and Chinese Medicine
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Japanese Medical School Accused of Rigging Admissions to Keep Women Out
description: A Japanese medical school has been accused of manipulating the test scores of female applicants for years to artificially depress the number of women in the student body, a scandal that has triggered sharp criticism.

title: Russia, Apple, Ernest Hemingway: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: How Paul Manaforts Plans Backfired
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: New York Today: A Picnic Packing List
description: Good morning on this spotty Friday.

title: Manufacturers Increase Efforts to Woo Workers to Rural Areas
description: They call it the Not So Heavy Metal tour. Its a lighthearted effort by Minnesota-based Alexandria Industries to introduce middle and high school students  as well the general public  to manufacturing.

title: The Great God of Depression
description: Nearly 30 years ago, the author William Styron outed himself in these pages as mentally ill. My days were pervaded by a gray drizzle of unrelenting horror, he wrote in a New York Times Op-Ed article, describing the deep depression that had landed him in the psych ward. He compared the agony of mental illness to that of a heart attack. Pain is pain, whether its in the mind or the body. So why, he asked, were depressed people treated as pariahs?

title: Follow the Money (Then Take a Picture)
description: Perhaps because she has spent her career watching the rich, the photographer and filmmaker Lauren Greenfield is herself rich to watch. At a party after the New York premiere of her new documentary  Generation Wealth, about the perils of capitalism  Ms. Greenfield was wired, welcoming and constantly working. She snapped pictures of the well-heeled crowd as she hugged her way around the room, occasionally misplacing a glass of white wine, in a churn of compliments and gossip.

title: Summer Reading Contest, Week 8: What Interested You Most in The Times This Week?
description: Update, Aug. 21: Winners have been announced!

title: DealBook Briefing: The Trouble With a $1 Trillion Apple
description: Good Friday morning. Want this in your inbox every morning? Sign up here.

title: A Museum Held a Show of Protest Art. Then the Artists Protested the Museum.
description: LONDON  Just after 11 a.m. on Thursday, a group of about 20 artists, many wearing black despite the searing sun, arrived at the Design Museum in London with an unusual aim: to remove their art from an exhibition.

title: Pompeo Warns Turkey on Detained U.S. Pastor: The Clock Has Run Out
description: SINGAPORE  Declaring that the clock had run out, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo urged Turkey on Friday to free an American pastor imprisoned on espionage charges, in a case that had spurred United States to impose sanctions against two top Turkish government officials.

title: Attackers in Burqas Kill Dozens at Shiite Mosque in Afghanistan
description: KHOST, Afghanistan  At least 29 people were killed when suicide bombers disguised in womens clothing stormed a Shiite mosque in eastern Afghanistan during Friday Prayer, officials said, the latest in a series of bloody attacks on the countrys Shiite minority.

title: This Week in Arts: Shakira, Battery Dance Festival, The Sinner
description: Aug. 10; ticketmaster.com.

title: The Abandon Whites Fantasy
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive the newsletter each weekday.

title: California Today: What Trumps Auto Emissions Plan Means for California
description: Good morning.

title: The Week in Tech: SoftBank Strikes Again
description: Each week, technology reporters and columnists from The New York Times review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

title: The Basic Ingredients for Your Podcast Recipe
description: Q. I want to make podcasts. How do I do it?

title: How Tech Billionaires Hack Their Taxes With a Philanthropic Loophole
description: Late in 2014, Nicholas Woodman, the founder and chief executive of GoPro, announced what appeared to be an extraordinary act of generosity.

title: China Threatens New Tariffs on $60 Billion of U.S. Goods
description: BEIJING  China threatened on Friday to tax an additional $60 billion a year worth of imports from the United States if the Trump administration imposes its own new levies on Chinese goods.

title: Wyatt Russell Taps Into His Hollywood DNA and Makes a Splash
description: Blessed with royal Hollywood DNA  his parents are Kurt Russell and Goldie Hawn, after all  Wyatt Russell was well positioned for movie stardom. But after roles alongside his father in Soldier and Escape From L.A., he wiped the stardust from his tender eyes and by 15 began mastering the skills to become a professional hockey player. Then injuries derailed his dreams, and he found himself back in front of the camera.

title: Two Netflix Original Dads, Incarnated by TV Favorites
description: Two new Netflix Original comedy films offer family dysfunction enacted by veteran television performers. Father of the Year, starring David Spade, the S.N.L. and Just Shoot Me alum, had its premiere on July 20, while Like Father, which debuted Aug. 3, features Kristen Bell, once the well-loved teenage detective of Veronica Mars, as the estranged daughter of Kelsey Grammer, who should need no introduction.

title: Village Townhouse Sale Breaks Record
description: The $37.2 million sale of an 1838 Greek Revival townhouse in Greenwich Village has set another record in New York City.

title: The Cast of The Bold Type on Staying Current
description: The Bold Type, which airs its Season 2 finale Tuesday on Freeform, is based on a familiar TV narrative: Smart young women living fun but complicated lives in New York City, where they pursue their dreams of career success and romance. For its sometimes realistic  and other times outrageous  portrayal of life as a young adult in New York, comparisons to shows like Sex and the City and Girls come easy.

title: Learning Lines. And Crossing Them.
description: I want to deepen the work, Evangeline says.

title: Brazils Supreme Court Considers Decriminalizing Abortion
description: PETRPOLIS, Brazil  For three days after she had an illegal abortion, Ingriane Barbosa Carvalho hemorrhaged in silence. Even as she writhed in pain, and an infection caused by the botched procedure spread, Ms. Carvalho insisted to relatives she was just nursing a stomach bug.

title: As Brexit Looms, Musicians Brace for the Worst
description: LONDON  The composer Howard Goodall was passing through a London airport in March en route to a conducting gig in Houston. Idling at the currency exchange desk, he got into a conversation with an employee about whether Britains departure from the European Union, known as Brexit, would be good for his industry. When Mr. Goodall said no and suggested that the consequences would be disastrous, the clerk replied that everyone he asked that question gives the same answer.

title: Five Weeknight Dishes
description: Good morning. Its Emily, in for Sam again, with five weeknight recipes for busy people who still want something good to eat. (If thats you, would you consider signing up for my new weeknight newsletter, which starts in September?) Sam will be back with you on Sunday.

title: Ebola Poses High Risk in Congo, W.H.O. Says
description: GENEVA  An outbreak of the Ebola virus in the Democratic Republic of Congo poses a high risk to the region, though the danger of the disease spreading worldwide was described as low, international health officials said on Friday.

title: Olympian Erin Hamlin Marries a Childhood Playmate
description: Jonathan Hodge has a reputation for pulling off small miracles on the basketball court. But the miracle hes proudest of  sweeping four-time Olympian Erin Hamlin off her feet  lends itself less to repeat viewings by his core audience of hoops fanatics and goggle-eyed Minnesota schoolchildren.

title: Deer Make the Worst Neighbors
description: Like many of us who choose to live in the suburbs, deer want a nice, safe neighborhood, with great food and plenty of privacy. For one particular doe and fawn, that neighborhood happens to be my backyard.

title: Review: Lodge 49, Where Beautiful Losers Join the Club
description: Its become a clich to ask about a TV drama, What are the stakes? Often the question embodies an assumption: that a story cant be worth your time unless its explosive and dire. Who gets killed? Whats everybody fighting over? How big are the dragons?

title: Indias Higher Education Troubles
description: When the Times Higher Education World University Rankings, which rates about 1,000 global institutions, was released in May, not even one Indian institute featured in the overall Top 100, though the Indian Institute of Science made it in the reputational rankings after seven years.

title: Rome Wasnt Sacked in a Day
description: ROME A History in Seven Sackings By Matthew Kneale Illustrated. 417 pp. Simon & Schuster. $30.

title: Trumps Economic Claims Are Overblown
description: For the second consecutive Friday, the Trump administration had an opportunity to point to fresh data that supposedly demonstrates the strong boost the presidents policies have given to the nations economy. Last week, news that the gross domestic product expanded at a 4.1 percent rate in the second quarter occasioned a presidential appearance on the south lawn of the White House. Fridays announcement that 157,000 new jobs were added in July was marked more modestly, with a statement from the White House.

title: From Rags to Ill-Gotten Riches in 1930s China
description: CITY OF DEVILS The Two Men Who Ruled the Underworld of Old Shanghai By Paul French 299 pp. Picador. $28

title: Do Cockroaches Carry Diseases?
description: A. The proven health risks of cockroach infestation seem to be predominantly those of filth, food contamination and allergic asthma rather than direct transmission of disease, according to an extensive review of public health risks from all kinds of pests conducted by the World Health Organization.

title: How to Listen to the Book Review Podcast
description: Each week on The New York Times Book Reviews podcast, the Book Reviews editor, Pamela Paul, speaks with authors, critics and Times reporters about the latest releases and news in the literary world. Heres how to listen:

title: Personal Stories From the Refugee Experience
description: BUTTERFLY From Refugee to Olympian: My Story of Rescue, Hope, and Triumph By Yusra Mardini with Josie Le Blond 284 pp. St. Martins. $26.99.

title: From Mission: Impossible to Godzilla: Plane Jumps in the Movies
description: Hollywood loves to throw people out of planes. Several big-budget movies over the last four years have sent their characters hurtling from aircraft for various narrative purposes. And yet the main reason may just be because its cool.

title: Watermill Center, All Star Code and Diana Rigg Held Parties
description: The summer charity circuit goes arty and techy in the Hamptons.

title: Lemon Bars, With Blueberries in a Supporting Role
description: The best lemon bars strike a perfect balance: Theyre both sweet and tangy, their sharp, creamy centers anchored by a crisp, buttery crust. My desert-island dessert, theyre the one confection I can imagine eating ad infinitum  or, at least until the rescue plane arrives.

title: Magic Ripples Just Below the Surface in These Novels
description: Some books are like tour guides. Grinning, they whisk you through enchanted avenues, each carefree laugh rehearsed and calculated, each anecdote sliding a little too smoothly into place. All the while, your eye wanders down the crooked back streets, and you wonder what myth and magic really goes on down there, what true, dirty, uncomfortable histories have been covered over. Other books feel more like an old friend  they take you by the hand and lead you through their hometown, explaining what needs to be explained, trusting youll figure out the rest.

title: The Literati: Henry Jamess Final Curtain Call
description: Concerned about diminishing royalties from his novels, Henry James in his mid-40s began to write plays. Over five years of failure, few made it to the stage, but one, Guy Domville, succeeded in opening at Londons St. Jamess Theater on Jan. 5, 1895. The highly respected George Alexander produced it and acted the title role.

title: A Tornado Took On New York. The Tornado Didnt Last Long.
description: New Yorkers have become somewhat inured to the various reasons that their smartphones vibrate with alerts. And then there was Thursday night, when a tornado warning sent phones and their owners buzzing.

title: Star Athlete Is Injured in Egg Attack, and Italy Debates a Racism Emergency
description: MONCALIERI, Italy  Daisy Osakue grabbed her pink sneakers from the terrace and packed them in a suitcase embossed with the Italian flag. All around her familys apartment, newspaper articles, old photos and posters hailed her success in track and field. Dozens of medals hung from pictures of her family celebrating in traditional Nigerian dress.

title: New in Paperback: An Odyssey, Dunbar
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: Hats Are Big This Summer. Really Big.
description: Fashion sometimes goes to gobsmacking, seemingly incomprehensible extremes. The gigantic straw sun hat of summer 2018 is one of those.

title: A Revolution Within the Revolution: Cuba Opens to Same-Sex Marriages
description: PARIS  I want to go there before things change is a phrase I hear often from friends considering a trip to Cuba. But change has been underway for over a decade, from the day Ral Castro became president after his brother Fidel fell ill in 2006. Since then, private property and self-employment have been legalized; tourism has boomed, benefiting thousands of Cubans who rent out rooms or serve meals in their apartments; and a lively art scene has sprouted in Havana, where artist-run spaces host exhibitions and lectures.

title: Notes From the Book Review Archives
description: Kate Tuttle reviews Anne Tylers most recent novel, Clock Dance, in this weeks issue. In 1985, Larry McMurtry expounded on Tylers skill and talent while writing about The Accidental Tourist for the Book Review. Read an excerpt below:

title: Want to Be Part of a Story About Crossword Solving?
description: Who are the passionate puzzle solvers who show up every day to talk about The New York Times Crossword? The Times would like to meet you.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The New Season Ticket, Seat Optional
description: The phrase is part of the lexicon of sports, signifying a fans ultimate expression of devotion to a team: season tickets. For every game, the fan would be there in the same seat, never missing a moment of the action.

title: Why Can I Sue My Employer? Is Often the Wrong Question
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: A Hiatus From Politics?
description: To the Editor:

title: That Huge Surprise in His Own Family Genealogy? Its Playing out in His Novels
description: Middle-grade author Alan Gratz isnt a genealogy buff, but his aunt is, and a few decades ago she traced the Gratz family line back to one Louis Alexander Gratz. He was a penniless Prussian orphan who came to the United States in the 1860s, joined the Union Army and fought his way south with Shermans troops, Gratz explains. But the most surprising thing she discovered about old L.A. Gratz was that he had a secret: He was Jewish, but had abandoned his religion and heritage when he made his new start in America. Family lore has it that learning our ancestors were Jewish is what gave my anti-Semitic grandfather a fatal heart attack.

title: A Sunflower Farm Invited Tourists. It Ended Up Like a Zombie Apocalypse.
description: This is a story about a good idea gone awry.

title: John James, Black and Republican, Thinks He Can Crack the Blue Wall in Michigan
description: Update: John James won the Republican primary on Tuesday night.

title: The National Comedy Center Opens, Jim Gaffigan Hologram and All
description: Jamestown, N.Y., has long been known as the hometown of the I Love Lucy star Lucille Ball (and the site of a much-mocked, since-remade sculpture of her). Now, the city is hoping to expand its reputation for humor with the opening this week of the National Comedy Center, a museum devoted to, as its website says, telling the vital story of comedy in America.

title: Buoyant Economy or a Blip? 4 Tips for Investing Before the Party Ends
description: When it comes to how the latest economic data could have an impact on investors, two opposite interpretations emerge.

title: Amare Stoudemire Is on a Religious Quest
description: The halls of the Jewish Museum in Manhattan were hushed and dim as Amare Stoudemire stepped inside. At nearly seven feet tall, the former New York Knicks star towered over the smattering of other visitors.

title: Lincoln Center Still Has Mostly Mozart, but What Is It?
description: Where a concert takes place can be as crucial to its success as the quality of the performance itself. So a shift of locale for a Mostly Mozart Festival concert at Lincoln Center last month proved something of a revelation, especially at a time when the center is grappling with confusion over its summer offerings.

title: The Trauma of Child Separation
description: To the Editor:

title: Pompeo Says Theres a Ways to Go Before North Korea Fulfills Nuclear Vows
description: SINGAPORE  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo expressed growing exasperation with North Korea on Friday, accusing its government of refusing to respect a promise to President Trump to stop, or even slow, Pyongyangs nuclear weapons program.

title: Beth Macy Talks About Dopesick
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: 100 Goats, Chewing Everything, Invade Boise Neighborhood
description: No blade of grass, no rose bush nor flower bed, was safe from the goats.

title: Good Things Happen When Bread Meets Eggs
description: The original egg on a roll was not bought from a cart on the streets of Manhattan, I imagine, but it is now a cheap, fast, made-to-order breakfast for New Yorkers of all stripes in a hurry. Wrapped in paper, the sandwich is as unassuming as it is satisfying.

title: A Cri de Coeur in a Pool of Milk: Decoding Salome in Salzburg
description: SALZBURG, Austria  So much almost happens in Romeo Castelluccis new production of Strausss Salome, playing at the Salzburg Festival through Aug. 27 and streaming online at medici.tv through Oct. 28.

title: The Met Opera and Two Unions Reach a Deal, Very Quietly
description: This time, it was pianissimo. Without the noisy rallies or vituperative broadsides that marked its last round of labor negotiations, the Metropolitan Opera and two of its biggest unions reached a tentative labor agreement Friday morning, paving the way for its season to open next month.

title: The Illness Is Bad Enough. The Hospital May Be Even Worse.
description: When she moved from Michigan to be near her daughter in Cary, N.C., Bernadine Lewandowski insisted on renting an apartment five minutes away.

description: To the Editor:

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: Emotional Abuse
description: Invisible blows can still leave scars.

description: To the Editor:

title: An Ancient River in Syria Sections Off a Modern War
description: ZOUR MAGHAR, Syria  On the eastern bank of the Euphrates River, Kurdish militiamen aligned with American troops burrow into sandbagged positions and eye their foes across the water.

title: Chris Rock Will Star in Fargo Season 4
description: The comedian Chris Rock will star in Season 4 of Fargo, John Landgraf, the CEO of FX Networks, announced on Friday during the Television Critics Association press tour.

title: Trump Will Have Blood on His Hands
description: The voice, if I had to guess, belongs to that of a white American male in late middle age. The accent is faintly Southern, the manner taunting but relaxed. Its also familiar: Im pretty sure hes left a message on my office number before. But the last voice mail left almost no impression. Not this time.

title: Art Lee, Fly-Fishing Virtuoso and Writer, Dies at 76
description: Art Lee, a writer and guide who described the sylvan joys  and the slyest tricks  of fly-fishing to generations of trout and salmon anglers, died on July 25 at a hospital in Middletown, N.Y. He was 76.

title: Deep Dives Into Justice From Shakespeare, Wilde and Atticus Finch
description: STRATFORD, Ontario  Weird things happen when you take a theatrical deep dive; you may even get a case of the bends.

title: A Pregnant Woman Ordered a Latte at McDonalds. She Received a Cup of Cleaning Fluid.
description: A McDonalds franchise in Canada has apologized after serving a pregnant woman a cup of cleaning fluid instead of coffee, a mistake the company said has occurred in the past with other customers.

title: Rick Genest, Tattooed Zombie Boy in Lady Gaga Video, Dies at 32
description: Rick Genest, a model who was known for his head-to-toe tattoos and for appearing in the music video for Lady Gagas 2011 song Born This Way, has died in Montreal. He was 32.

title: 2 Workers at Arizona Migrant Children Centers Are Charged With Sexual Abuse
description: Two youth care workers at Arizona shelters for migrant children have been charged with sexually assaulting immigrant teenagers, according to court records. They are the latest claims of abuse at government-contracted shelters that have a key role in the Trump administrations hard-line immigration crackdown.

title: Christopher Gibbs, Avatar of Swinging London, Dies at 80
description: Christopher Gibbs, an erudite London antiques dealer and dandy who introduced the raffish distressed bohemian style to interior design and helped start the Peacock Revolution in mens wear, died early Sunday at his home in Tangier, Morocco. Only minutes earlier, at midnight, he had turned 80.

title: Beyonc and Jay-Z Squeeze Triumph From Reconciliation
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Before Beyonc and Jay-Z even made it to the MetLife Stadium stage here on Thursday night, the rain arrived for a baptism. Everyone in the audience was ordered to leave their seats and take shelter, and the beginning of the show was delayed more than an hour. As the skies opened, the stadium floor was empty and still, anticipating renewal.

title: Feminists in Line for Free Lipstick
description: We were in a line that wrapped halfway around a city block, and we were talking about color: red versus pink, shimmery versus matte. One woman liked that peach gloss Michelle Obama goes for; another thought Meghan Markle had a nice defined nude thing going.

title: Better Call Saul Starts Its Fourth Season, Still Waiting for Saul
description: For three seasons, Better Call Saul has been an exercise in narrative delayed gratification: saving itself, postponing consummation, keeping its two story lines  fated to someday converge  apart for as long as possible.

title: Why a Trade Truce Could Add Almost $2 Trillion to the Stock Market
description: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines  and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

title: Read These 3 Books About Global Warming
description: This year has seen record-high temperatures around the world, including in Japan, where triple-digit temperatures killed at least 86 people since May and hospitalized more than 20,000 over one week in July. According to scientists, this is an upward trend, and 2018 may be one of the hottest years on record. Here are three books that predict how global warming may affect humanity and what we can still do.

title: Weinstein Releases Emails Suggesting Long Relationship With Accuser
description: The attorney for Harvey Weinstein accused the Manhattan district attorneys office on Friday of withholding hundreds of emails from the grand jury that suggest the producers relationship with a woman accusing him of rape was consensual and lasted for years after the alleged attack.

title: The Real Cost of Keeping Les Moonves
description: Leslie Moonves is a rainmaker and a kingmaker. As the chief executive of CBS, he transformed the television network from last place to most watched. Hes made careers, and he has made a fortune, for himself and for his employer. And thats probably why the CBS board decided to let him keep his job despite allegations in a recent expos in The New Yorker that he sexually harassed women and helped foster a climate of harassment throughout the company.

title: Beachfront Soundtrack: The Week in Classical Music
description: [Read all of our classical coverage here.]

title: Pelotons New Infusion Made It a $4 Billion Company in 6 Years
description: For Pelotons first two years in business, venture capital investors didnt get it. The companys founders struggled to convince them that blending stationary bikes and streaming live video classes would work. It had to cobble together money from a network of more than 200 angel investors to get off the ground.

title: Mary Carlisle, Depression-Era Movie Ingnue, Is Dead at 104
description: Mary Carlisle, an angel-faced blond actress who often played spunky but innocent ingnues in scores of Depression-era films, died on Wednesday in the Woodland Hills section of Los Angeles. She was 104.

title: Zimbabwes Opposition Calls Vote Results Fraudulent in Tense Aftermath
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  Presidential election results showing that the man who ousted Robert Mugabe in a coup last year in Zimbabwe had won his own term in office were fraudulent and illegitimate, the main opposition candidate said on Friday as he vowed to challenge them in the courts.

title: This Weeks Wedding Announcements
description: Jeanie Walls Knigin and William Gary Knisely met in 2016, after a woman whom Ms. Knigin knew referred Mr. Knisely to her as a potential date. It turned out that he had been out with several other women in Ms. Knigins sphere, but none had been quite right, and each had suggested that he might contact another acquaintance.

description: Just how bad will Jimmy McGill break this season? Thats the big question for viewers as Better Call Saul returns to AMC for Season 4 on Monday, Aug. 6. Created by Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould as a prequel to Breaking Bad, Saul stars Bob Odenkirk as its title character  sort of.
